data.question: What is the effect of maltol post-treatment on the charge carrier lifetimes of mixed lead-tin perovskite films?
data.answer: Maltol post-treatment led to charge carrier lifetimes in excess of 7 ms.

data.question: How does the addition of maltol affect the photoluminescence intensity of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite films?
data.answer: The addition of maltol resulted in a fivefold increase in photoluminescence intensity.

data.question: What is the role of TM-DHP in the synthesis of mixed lead-tin perovskite films?
data.answer: TM-DHP acts as a Sn(IV) scavenger, reducing Sn(IV) content in the perovskite films.

data.question: What is the impact of Sn(IV) content on the surface of perovskite films after various treatments?
data.answer: The Sn(IV) content was reduced from 9% in control films to 3% in films treated with both TM-DHP and maltol.

data.question: How does the power conversion efficiency (PCE) of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite solar cells change with maltol post-treatment?
data.answer: The PCE of the champion device fabricated with both Sn(IV) scavenging and maltol post-treatment was 21.4%.

data.question: What is the relationship between the addition of Cs and the band gap of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite absorbers?
data.answer: The addition of Cs did not significantly change the band gap, which remained within the optimal range of 1.2-1.4 eV.

data.question: How does the addition of maltol and TM-DHP affect the crystallinity of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite films?
data.answer: The addition of TM-DHP and maltol led to an improvement in film crystallinity, as indicated by stronger intensities of XRD peaks.

data.question: What is the effect of reducing the Sn(IV) content on the performance of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite solar cells?
data.answer: Reducing the Sn(IV) content by using TM-DHP and maltol treatments led to improved device performance, with a PCE increase to 21.4%.

data.question: How does the surface treatment with maltol influence the oxidation resistance of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite films?
data.answer: Maltol surface treatment effectively suppresses Sn(II) oxidation and reduces the density of defects at the perovskite film surface.

data.question: What is the significance of the charge carrier lifetime in the performance of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite solar cells?
data.answer: A longer charge carrier lifetime, as achieved with maltol treatment, indicates suppressed non-radiative recombination, leading to improved solar cell efficiency.

data.question: Is the Sn(IV) content on the surface of perovskite films reduced after TM-DHP treatment?
Does the maltol post-treatment decrease the photoluminescence intensity of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite films?
Is the power conversion efficiency of mixed Pb-Sn perovskite solar cells unaffected by maltol post-treatment?
Does the addition of Cs to the perovskite composition significantly increase the band gap beyond the optimal range for solar cells?
Can TM-DHP alone bring the Sn(IV) content at the perovskite film surface to 0%?
Does the combination of TM-DHP scavenging and maltol post-treatment lead to a decrease in the charge carrier lifetime?
